settings.question: 12 Sex Positive Podcasts You Need to Add to Your Playlist Stat!
settings.answer-new: These days there’s a podcast for everything, and sex is no exception! Whether you’re looking for something educational, entertaining, funny, scientific or smutty, we’ve compiled a list of the best sex-positive podcasts for your listening pleasure. So, pop on your headphones and get set to enter a shame and judgement-free zone. Happy listening!

settings.question: Sextras
settings.answer-new:
Sextras is a podcast about sex, dating, relationships and all the extras. Best friends Honey Jane Wyatt and Maria Jose Hayaux du Tilly paint a candid picture of relationships and dating in their 20s, from sharing funny stories, to hard life lessons learnt (and learning). Typical episodes go from heavy discussions about whether they’re difficult to love to cringing at sex stores from their listeners and each other. Listen in to hear two girls talking about all the details of their sex and love lives, and to maybe learn something along the way.

Listen Here

settings.question: Dating Games
settings.answer-new:
Press play on the show to hear comedians, dating coaches and matchmakers delve into the world of modern relationships. Each chat begins with a weird or ridiculous dating experience before getting into their unique approach to relationships in this strange time.

Through these powerful episodes your hosts Bobby Temps & Stephanie Foster uncover what not to do when looking for love and points are awarded for the best insights. There’s never been a better time to level up with Dating Games.

Silver Award Winner at The Irish Podcast Awards.

Listen here

settings.question: Better Sleep
settings.answer-new:
CockTales: Dirty Discussions is hosted by Kiki Said So and Medinah Monroe. Both women are in different stages of their love lives; one single and one in a serious long term relationship. The women give uncensored accounts about their sex and dating lives, relationships, and what it's really like to navigate the sea of love in Atlanta. On CockTales, the ladies gather over great drinks and discuss the latest happenings in their sexual experiences dating lives.

Listen here

settings.question: The Sexual Wellness Sessions
settings.answer-new:
The Sexual Wellness Sessions Podcast is a series of interviews hosted by Psychosexual and Relationship Therapist Kate Moyle.

So many of these conversations about sex and relationships are happening behind the therapy room door; and Kate wants to bring them into the mainstream so that sexual wellbeing can get the attention it deserves.

This series of interviews is about changing narratives, challenging beliefs, breaking away from feelings of shame and helping people to normalise talking about sex and relationships; all of which can get in the way of people having the sex lives and relationships that they want.

These discussions are about opening up the conversation, and showing the normality of an imperfect sex life and exploring themes such as desire, fantasies, sexual difficulties, relationship models, mindful sex and more, with a series of guests and experts from the sexual wellness space.

Listen here

settings.question: Probably True
settings.answer-new:
Stories of queer life and even queer-er sex.

The repeatedly award-winning, slightly filthy storytelling project tackling LGBTQ issues in a fun and engaging way. Created to remind all of our queer siblings that we are none of us alone.

Much like its creator, it’s a smutty-but-charming collection of personal misadventures working to make the world a better place, one silly, sexy story at a time.

Listen here

settings.question: Strengthen Your Pelvic Floor
settings.answer-new: We’re all familiar with the fact that we should do Kegel exercises to strengthen and tone our pelvic floor right?But did you know that the same muscles are engaged during an orgasm – so getting your rocks off on the regular can help maintain the health and strength of your pelvic floor.

settings.question: A Workout for Your Brain
settings.answer-new: In research conducted on how the brain responds to sexual stimulation and orgasms, Dr Nan Wise found that it can have significant benefits for our brains. “We found that orgasms increased blood flow to so many regions that the brain [lit] up like a Christmas tree,” Dr Wise explains. “Increased blood flow means that the brain is getting a wonderful nutritious workout.”

settings.question: A More Youthful Appearance
settings.answer-new: Don’t give up your skincare regime just yet, but there is some evidence that orgasms can help slow the ageing process? How? Well, orgasms help to keep your blood pressure low. They also boost your estrogen levels, which in turn increases collagen which helps to keep your skin looking plump and youthful.

settings.question: Summary
settings.answer-new: So, ladies, it would seem that if you want less sick days off work,better sleep, less wrinkles and a pelvic floor you could crack a walnut with…getting your vibe on could very well be the best way to go about it!
